snippet: President Obama and his allies made the case for him as commander in chief and criticized their rivals’ lack of experience, with Mr. Obama saying Mitt Romney was stuck in a “cold war time warp.”
abstract: Pres Obama and his allies use the final night of the Democratic convention to make a case for him as a steady commander in chief in a dangerous world, while accusing Mitt Romney of recklessness and a reliance on 'neocon advisers'.
lead_paragraph: President Obama and his allies made the case for him as commander in chief and criticized their rivals’ lack of experience, with Mr. Obama saying Mitt Romney was stuck in a “cold war time warp.”

headline.seo: Obama and Democrats Point to Foreign Policy Strength
headline.main: Obama and Democrats Point to Foreign Policy Strength
headline.print_headline: Seeking to Make Case for Obama on Strength of His Foreign Policy
